section: A. In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
explanation: The section discusses a minimum number of tournaments the consultant must play, represented by '[* ****]', and the consequences of not meeting this requirement. The subsequent sentence refers to '[*****]' events, which is inconsistent with the initial term '[* ****]'. This creates an in-text contradiction.

section:
A. In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year:
1. Year 1. $[*****]
2. Year 2 $[*****]
3. Year 3 $[*****]
4. Year 4 $[*****]
5. Year 5 $[*****]
B.Payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within one month following the end of the calendar year. For example, if in the calendar year 2005 CONSULTANT achieves a satisfactory record of play in [*****] events, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF [*****] dollars no later than January 31, 2006.
explanation: The passage refers to repayment amounts for failing to meet a minimum number of tournaments. However, specific dollar figures are redacted and filled with '[*****]'. This omission makes it impossible to determine the actual financial obligations, creating ambiguity. The lack of specific repayment amounts makes the clause unenforceable and is a structural flaw.

section: Notwithstanding any other paragraph of this Agreement, in the event that CONSULTANT dies or is unable to play tour golf at all, ADAMS GOLF may terminate this Agreement on thirty (30) days' written notice. Upon such termination, CONSULTANT and/or CONSULTANT'S estate shall be required to repay ADAMS GOLF for that period of the Agreement not performed by CONSULTANT. The repayment amount shall be calculated in the same way as repayment is calculated under paragraph 8A.
explanation: This section discusses termination due to the consultant's death or inability to play, requiring repayment. However, it references paragraph 8A for the calculation method, but paragraph 8A deals with repayment for failing to meet a *minimum number of tournaments*, not death or total inability. This creates an in-text contradiction, as the calculation method doesn't logically apply to the circumstance of death or complete inability to play.
